evaluation.description:
**Detailed Description of Differences:**

1. **Vertical White Rectangles:** The first image has two vertical white rectangles of different sizes on the right side. The second image also has two vertical white rectangles but they are equal in size and positioned differently.
2. **Horizontal Red Rectangle:** In the first image, the red rectangle is positioned at the bottom of the white horizontal rectangle, closer to the right edge. In the second image, the red rectangle spans the entire width at the bottom, directly below the white rectangles.
3. **Black Rectangle:** The black rectangle in the first image is positioned at the bottom right, with a red rectangle on top of it. In the second image, the black rectangle is also at the bottom right but appears larger because the red rectangle spans across, covering part of it.

**Similarity Score:** 6/10

The images share a similar composition with the same colors (yellow, white, red, gray, and black) and overall layout. However, the arrangement and proportions of the rectangles differ significantly.

**Suggestions for Modification:**

To make the second image more similar to the first:

1. **Adjust the Vertical White Rectangles:** Make the two vertical white rectangles of different sizes as in the first image.
2. **Reposition the Red Rectangle:** Move the red rectangle to sit on top of the black rectangle, closer to the right edge, and ensure it does not span the entire width.
3. **Resize the Black Rectangle:** Adjust the size of the black rectangle so it matches the proportions seen in the first image, ensuring the red rectangle fits on top of it without covering the entire bottom width.

By implementing these changes, the second image will more closely resemble the first in terms of composition and details.
